results.title: Prime Suspect: the lost child
results.creator_credit: John Madden, Paul Marcus and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: When a 14 month old child disappears, Jane Tennison (Helen Mirren) is called in to lead the investigation. The case hits a raw nerve with Jane who is recovering from an abortion, as well as affecting DI Muddyman (Jack Ellis), for reasons he doesn’t wish to disclose. There is only one prime suspect, Chris Hughes (Robert Glenister), a recovering paedophile who is now living with a woman who has two young children. Tennison’s investigation is hampered by the lack of staff allocated to a kidnapping, the numbers increase, as does the personal involvement, when the case turns into a murder investigation. The Criminal psychologist (Stuart Wilson) who treated Hughes is convinced Hughes is incapable of murder, although he is capable of being pushed over the edge due to intense police scrutiny during the investigation. With Muddyman involved, this is a very probable scenario.

results.title: Prime suspect 3
results.creator_credit: David Drury, Paul Marcus and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: DCI Tennison (Helen Mirren) has made it in a man’s world and secured the position of a high ranking policewoman. In this third instalment of Lynda La Plante’s series Tennison is given the assignment of cleaning up the murky world of prostitutes, or “rent boys”, due to public pressure about the standard of morality in Soho- Operation Contract. The nature of her assignment quickly changes tack when one of the boys perishes in a suspicious fire. Strange details begin to emerge, such as forensic evidence that the victim was unconscious when the fire started and someone called an ambulance to the flat that night The suspects soon mount- the sleazy pimp, the head of a centre for troubled boys, and a respected police official. Tennison’s personal life is not without upheaval during the investigation as an old flame enters the scene, causing her to question life’s decisions. As Tennison leads her investigative team into an underworld populated by paedophiles, pornographic photography, transvestites and abuse, the shocking truth is revealed and Helen must make an important decision. Cast includes Vera Reynolds, David Thewlis, Danny Dyer, Tom Bell and Ciaran Hinds.

results.title: Primary education in England
results.brief_description: The Sea Mills Infant School in Bristol, one of the leading infant schools in England, is seen as an extension of the environment of home and family. This documentary film follows the interaction of teacher and children as the children’s energies and interests are directed toward self-selected learning activities. Suitable for teacher training. Narrated by Kathleen Brearley Andrews.

results.title: Primary colors
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Mutual Film Company and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Jack Stanton is a governor from a small southern state who, while sincere in his devotion to the American people, is nevertheless plagued by scandal at every twist on the campaign trail to the presidency. Includes music score by Ry Cooder. Cast includes John Travolta, Emma Thompson, Billy Bob Thornton, Kathy Bates, Adrian Lester, Larry Hagman and Diane Ladd.
